poem:
Title: "Voices of the Silent Politics"

In the quiet chambers, whispers dwell
Men of power, their secrets tell,
To be for, against; the world in scale.
A line in sand, a tipping scale.

Voices cry for truths unsaid,
Palestine's ghost in their head.
Puppets dance on Jerusalem's thread,
Wake, O Britain, to the dread.

Speak, lest silence becomes our fall,
Where stands justice in these hallowed halls?
